content: quote: Originally posted by CorporalMcIntyre: quote: Originally posted by 18137072: quote: Originally posted by AGBrina: It seems to me that there has become an enormous disconnect between the NCOs of the U.S. military and the code of conduct (and honor) to which the U.S. military has aspired since George Washington himself set the example. There is never a justification for savagery, brutality, murder or even lesser forms of violent crimes. But there has been so many cases which have been dismissed, or convictions on lesser charges, that The NCOs must think that the officers would rather "look the other way" than enforce the law. The following link connects one to the U.S. Army Medical Report on the degradation in Ethics, Discipline, Morale among the Soldiers and Marines serving in Iraq. The effects of poor leadership and the stress associated with cumulative tours of service led to widespread abuses by our military against Iraqis - against both civilians and insurgents. The data was collected between September and October 2006; and was completed in November of 2006. However, it was not released to the Public until May 16, 2007. In other words, it was witheld until this administration got what it wanted out of the new Democratic-majority Congress: no time limits for U.S. withdrawal, authorization for the surge, the extension of Iraqi tours from 12 to 15 months. http://www.armymedicine.army.mil/reports/mhat/mhat.html The report I refer to in particular is Report IV. There has since been a report V. The point to be emphasized here is that our military men feel either that these Iraqis "are just getting what they deserve"; or that no Iraqi life deserves justice, if a member of the U.S. military should face severe punishment as a consquence. They would not get that feeling if the officer corps did not share it. "An ENORMOUS Disconnect between NCO's of the US Military and the Code of Condduct" Hmmm, seems to me the enormous disconnect, is between your ears bud. you accuse all NCO's because of the acts of several such as these? How Many NCO's are there in the US Military? How many have been accused of Criminality? How many have been Convicted? whats the percentage to the total NCO force? Bet your azz it would be, but you see fit to impugne todays NCO's because you see an article about 4 dishonoring the rest?
